Package thing.dna

Class C_GenomeEucaryote

  • java.lang.Object
    • thing.dna.A_GenomeLuca
      • thing.dna.C_GenomeEucaryote
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    I_ConstantNumeric, I_ConstantString, I_DiploidGenome
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    C_GenomeAnimalia, C_GenomeSpermatophyta
    public class C_GenomeEucaryote
extends A_GenomeLuca
implements I_DiploidGenome, I_ConstantNumeric, I_ConstantString
    Defines a diploid and sexed genome. It owns a sexual chromosome pair with a sex locus (and possibly room for sexual behaviour coding).
    A genome should be able to own several C_ChromosomePairs. A genome may be assimilated to an egg.
    Author:
    Jean Le Fur, lefur@ird.fr 2011 adapted from PulseRateGenome kyle wagner, elyk@acm.org; Aurore Comte 2012 Version 2, 01.2011/09.2011/01.2012/03.2012
    See Also:
    C_Egg

      protected java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<C_Chromosome>> xsomesMatch​(java.util.ArrayList<C_Chromosome> gametesThis, java.util.ArrayList<C_Chromosome> gametesPartner)
      If we are in the case of an hybrid with gametes of different sizes, we transform the gamete with the largest number of chromosomes into a list that matches the number of chromosomes of the smallest gametes (with the corresponding genes)in order to make pairs compatible with the chromosome pairs factory (cricketsim) CAUTION : every chromosomes are split into single genes.

    • Method Detail

      • makeGametes

        public java.util.ArrayList<C_Chromosome> makeGametes()
        Simulates meiosis with crossing over. Meiosis 2 is not formalized. It would necessitate to duplicate (using the java clone()) the chromosomes pairs Authors J.Le Fur, A. Comte - 01.2012
        Specified by:
        makeGametes in interface I_DiploidGenome

      • segregation

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<C_Chromosome>> segregation()
        The first chromosome of a multivalent are put randomly into one of two gametes. The other chromosomes of the multivalent have a biggest probability of being put in the other gamete. Author A. Comte and J.Le Fur 03/2012
        Returns:
        the list of possible gametes (containing multivalents) made by this this genome (even non-viable gametes).

      • xsomeFission

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<C_Chromosome>> xsomeFission()
        Chromosomes pairs of hybrid autosomes are separated and strands that are constituted of several chromosomes (e.g., M. erythroleucus) are broken into these several original chromosomes. Author J.Le Fur and A. Comte 03/2012
        Returns:
        the list of autosomal multivalents. That is to say, a list of lists of chromosomes.

      • searchAGene

        private boolean searchAGene​(C_Gene gene,
                            java.util.ArrayList<C_Chromosome> gamete)
        To know if a particular gene is present on a chromosome in a list of chromosomes (ie: a gamete) / Author J.Le Fur and A. Comte
        Returns:
        true (if the gene is in the list) or false (if the gene isn't)

      • makeZygoteXsomes

        protected java.util.ArrayList<C_ChromosomePair> makeZygoteXsomes​(java.lang.Object mutRate,
                                                                 I_DiploidGenome partnerGenome)
        Fusion of the gametes of the mother and the father / Author J.Le Fur, A. Comte - 21.02.2012 mate has been split into mate and makeZygoteXsomes since, initially, only (e.g.) a mastomys genome can make a mastomys genome.
        Parameters:
        mutRate -
        partnerGenome -
        Returns:
        the list of ChromosomePair of the genome of the future offspring.

      • xsomesMatch

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<C_Chromosome>> xsomesMatch​(java.util.ArrayList<C_Chromosome> gametesThis,
                                                                             java.util.ArrayList<C_Chromosome> gametesPartner)
        If we are in the case of an hybrid with gametes of different sizes, we transform the gamete with the largest number of chromosomes into a list that matches the number of chromosomes of the smallest gametes (with the corresponding genes)in order to make pairs compatible with the chromosome pairs factory (cricketsim) CAUTION : every chromosomes are split into single genes. Author J.Le Fur and A. Comte 03/2012
        Parameters:
        gametesThis - , gametesPartner two gametes of different sizes
        Returns:
        the two gametes with the same size

      • mateGenomes

        public I_DiploidGenome mateGenomes​(java.lang.Object mutRate,
                                   I_DiploidGenome partnerGenome)
        Chooses the appropriate genome class for the zygote depending on the genome classes of its parents. upper class if hybrid, same class if pure. Transforms the list of chromosomes Pair of the offspring into a new genome which can be any type of genome, depending on the genomes of the parents. Author J.Le Fur, A. Comte 01/03/2012
        Specified by:
        mateGenomes in interface I_DiploidGenome
        Parameters:
        mutRate -
        partnerGenome -
        Returns:
        the zygote's diploid Genome

      • getDiploidNumber

        public int getDiploidNumber()
        Count the number of genes coming from different chromosomes for each chromosome. If the count is done on the whole genome and not chromosome by chromosome, the count is going to be underestimated. Indeed, the offsprings of an inbreeding may have two chromosomes identical.
        Specified by:
        getDiploidNumber in interface I_DiploidGenome
        Overrides:
        getDiploidNumber in class A_GenomeLuca
        Returns:
        The diploid number (2n): number of chromosome pairs, including gonosomes and microsatellites.

      • isHybrid

        protected boolean isHybrid​(java.util.ArrayList<C_ChromosomePair> xsomes)
        Compute if the xsomes in the arguments are hybrid or not. original taxon is expressed as two decimals after the gene value. These decimals values are compared. Author J.Le Fur and A. Comte. March 2012
